pages.title: ⤝ Eight of Swords ⤝
pages.text: Spirit of Shortened Force$(br)     ♃ Jupiter in ♊ Gemini

A person is tied in bloody bandages and blindfolded, trapped between swords in a dark field.$(br)  It seems the ambush from the $(l:patchouli:swords/7)previous card$() has now transpired. If they try to move now, they'll get cut.$(br)  Yet it is rather a temporary durance than an irretrievable bondage.$(br)  The bandages can stand here for our efforts to contain our pain.$(br)  Is it an act of decency, even civilization, to bury

anger? Or is it repression? Some situations really do require anger.$(br)  How many of us have swallowed anger at injustice because we learned as children not to 'make a scene'? Yet, seething arguments have killed many relationships.$(br)  And what of the other Sword quality, clear thought?$(br)  The blindfold symbolizes confusion, especially the attempt by others to keep us mystified and unable to see our situation factually.

The untying of bandages and blindfold would mean a liberation through coherent thinking. $(br2)$(l)Divinatory meanings$()$(br)  Concealing or burying feelings of aggression. Acting polite or nice in a forced way.$(br)  Allowing others to confuse us. Crisis, censure, also sickness.$(br2)$(l)Reversed$()$(br)  Disquiet, difficulty. Releasing anger or other
strong emotions.$(br)  Seeing unforeseen things clearly, especially after a period of confusion.
